com.salesforce.androidsdk.app
Class ForceApp

java.lang.Object
  Application
      com.salesforce.androidsdk.app.ForceApp
All Implemented Interfaces:
AccountWatcher.AccountRemoved
public abstract class ForceApp
extends Application
implements AccountWatcher.AccountRemoved

Super class for all force applications. You should extend this class or make sure to initialize HttpAccess in your application's onCreate method.

Method Detail

getMainActivityClass

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Activity> getMainActivityClass()
Returns:
The class for the main activity.

getKey

protected abstract java.lang.String getKey(java.lang.String name)
This function must return the same value for name even when the application is restarted. The value this function returns must be Base64 encoded. Encryptor.isBase64Encoded(String) can be used to determine whether the generated key is Base64 encoded. Encryptor.hash(String, String) can be used to generate a Base64 encoded string. For example: Encryptor.hash(name + "12s9adfgret=6235inkasd=012", name + "12kl0dsakj4-cuygsdf625wkjasdol8");

Parameters:
name - The name associated with the key.
Returns:
The key used for encrypting salts and keys.

getSalesforceR

public SalesforceR getSalesforceR()
Before 1.3, SalesforceSDK was packaged as a jar, and project had to provide a subclass of SalesforceR. Since 1.3, SalesforceSDK is packaged as a library project and we no longer need to to that.

Returns:
SalesforceR object which allows reference to resources living outside the SDK.

getLoginActivityClass

public java.lang.Class<? extends Activity> getLoginActivityClass()
Returns:
the class of the activity used to perform the login process and create the account. You can override this if you want to customize the LoginAcitivty

onCreate

public void onCreate()

onTerminate

public void onTerminate()

shouldLogoutWhenTokenRevoked

public boolean shouldLogoutWhenTokenRevoked()
Returns whether the SDK should automatically logout when the access token is revoked. This should be overridden to return false, if the app wants to handle cleanup by itself when the access token is revoked.

Returns:
True - if the SDK should automatically logout, False - otherwise.

getUserAgent

public final java.lang.String getUserAgent()
Get a user agent string based on the mobile SDK version. We are building a user agent of the form: SalesforceMobileSDK/ android/ appName/appVersion

Returns:
The user agent string to use for all requests.

Returns:
true if this is an hybrid application
